required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetic Study of Paracetamol in Patients Over 80 Years Hospitalized to an Acute Geriatric Ward
clinical_study.official_title: Pharmacokinetic Study of Paracetamol in Patients Over 80 Years Hospitalized to an Acute Geriatric Ward

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this exploratory study is the characterization of the pharmacokinetic profile of paracetamol in older patients and the specific PK variables associated with plasma exposure in this population.

detailed_description.textblock:
The goal of this exploratory study is the characterization of the pharmacokinetic profile of paracetamol in older patients and the specific PK variables associated with plasma exposure in this population. The primary endpoint is the identification of the pharmacokinetic parameters: area under the curve (AUC), peak plasma concentration after administration of paracetamol (Cmax) and the time at which the Cmax is observed (Tmax) of paracetamol. The secondary endpoint consists of 3 sub-endpoints:
1. The variability in plasma exposure: volume of distribution (Vd), clearance (Cl) and elimination half-life (t1/2)
2. The association between the PK parameters and pathophysiological factors
3. The correlation between PK parameters and clinical parameters.

primary_outcome.measure: Identification of the pharmacokinetic parameters: AUC
primary_outcome.time_frame: 8 hours (= during 1 dosing interval at steady state)

primary_outcome.measure: Identification of the pharmacokinetic parameters: Cmax
primary_outcome.time_frame: 8 hours (= during 1 dosing interval at steady state)
primary_outcome.description: Peak plasma concentration after administration of paracetamol (Cmax)

primary_outcome.measure: Identification of the pharmacokinetic parameters: Tmax
primary_outcome.time_frame: 8 hours (= during 1 dosing interval at steady state)
primary_outcome.description: The time at which the Cmax is observed (Tmax) of paracetamol

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 8 hours (= during 1 dosing interval at steady state)
8 hours (= during 1 dosing interval at steady state)
8 hours (= during 1 dosing interval at steady state)

secondary_outcome.measure: The association between the AUC (area under the curve) of paracetamol and patient related factors.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 8 hours (= during 1 dosing interval at steady state)
secondary_outcome.description: Multivariate analysis will be performed with AUC (area under the curve) as outcome. This will allow to identify variables influencing AUC of paracetamol. Patient related factors include amongst others age, weight, albumin, bilirubin, serum creatinin and co medication.

secondary_outcome.measure: The association between the AUC (area under the curve) of paracetamol and pain scores.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 8 hours (= during 1 dosing interval at steady state)
secondary_outcome.description: Pain scores will be based on the Numeric Rating Scale with a score of 0 indicating no pain and a score of 10 indicating worst imaginable pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between immuno assay method and the Liquid chromatography-tandem mass spectrometry (LC-MS/MS) method to determine paracetamol concentrations in serum
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 8 hours (= during 1 dosing interval at steady state)
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation between two different assays will be determined through Bland Altman statistics.

arm_group.description: Patients received paracetamol one gram three times daily. Venopuncture for PK profiling
Patients received paracetamol one gram three times daily. Venopuncture for PK profiling

intervention.description: Blood samples at T0, T0.5, T1, T2, T4, T6

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- a minimum age of 80 years
- admission to the acute geriatrics ward
- oral intake of paracetamol 1000 milligram (mg) in tablet form tid
- a steady state situation (defined as at least 4 consecutive intakes of paracetamol before sampling)
Exclusion Criteria:
- palliative care setting with downgrading of care
